name: Assembly of European Regions
membership:
Global Taskforce of Local and Regional Governments 
European Countryside Movement
goal:
The Assembly of European Regions (est.1985) is the largest independent network of regions in the wider Europe. Bringing together 150+ regions from 35 countries and 15 interregional organisations, AER's mission is to be the voice of the regions of Europe:
- Promoting regional interests in Europe and beyond;
- Fostering interregional cooperation to promote the exchange of experience and the development of regional policy.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Culture, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, Food Safety, Institutional affairs, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: Policies and legislation with an impact at the regional level, more specifically in the fields of economy and regional development, cohesion policy, public health and social affairs, youth, culture, education, international cooperation, equal opportunities, institutional affairs.
